block.p: Leslie Cameron Schutz, a daughter of Suzanne and Herbert Dietrich Schutz of Greenwich, Conn., was married at her parents' house last evening to Constantine Panayotis Panayotopoulos, the son of Martha M. Murray and Panayotis Panayotopoulos, both of Athens. The Rev. George Poulos, a Greek Orthodox priest, performed the ceremony, in which the Rev. Dr. John Prescott Robertson, a Congregational minister, took part.

Mrs. Panayotopoulos, 27, is a coordinator for the Greek Film Center, a government cultural affairs office in Athens. Her father, who retired as the president of the New York Graphic Society, a fine arts publishing unit of Time Inc., is a private dealer in American art. Her mother is the board secretary of the Royal Oak Foundation, the United States arm of the National Trust of England, Wales and Northern Ireland, a conservation group.

Leslie Cameron Schutz, a daughter of Suzanne and Herbert Dietrich Schutz of Greenwich, Conn., was married at her parents' house last evening to Constantine Panayotis Panayotopoulos, the son of Martha M. Murray and Panayotis Panayotopoulos, both of Athens. The Rev. George Poulos, a Greek Orthodox priest, performed the ceremony, in which the Rev. Dr. John Prescott Robertson, a Congregational minister, took part.

Mrs. Panayotopoulos, 27, is a coordinator for the Greek Film Center, a government cultural affairs office in Athens. Her father, who retired as the president of the New York Graphic Society, a fine arts publishing unit of Time Inc., is a private dealer in American art. Her mother is the board secretary of the Royal Oak Foundation, the United States arm of the National Trust of England, Wales and Northern Ireland, a conservation group.

Mr. Panayotopoulos, 30, graduated from Adelphi University in Garden City, N.Y. He is the director of marketing for C. Vlachopoulos, an Athens company that sells office equipment. His father is the company's president and also president of Anatron Investments in Athens. The bridegroom's mother is the guidance counselor at Pierce College, a middle and high school in Athens.
